user_query: and accepts the influence that society was having on him during the time Thao worked for Walt and after his debt was paid restoring honor to Thao's family Walt develops a friendship with Thao and his sister Sue he is no longer the angry anti-social person he was at the beginning of the film he doesn't give up the racial slurs but there's no longer any animosity behind his remarks that are racist plenty of beer how's it say hey what's what are you fish heads looking at anyway I think we should go into the other room not even a child people believe that the soul resides on the head so uh don't do that well sounds dumb but fine yeah and a lot of Hmong people consider looking someone in the eye to be very rude that's why they look away when you look at them yeah anything else yeah some Hmong people tend to smile or grin when they're yelled at it's a cultural thing it expresses embarrassment or insecurity it's not that they're laughing at you or anything you people are nuts in Gran Torino non-verbal codes are evident in a number of instances in which to a large extent seem to be the source of cultural conflict for instance Walt being American he's accustomed to looking at people straight into their eyes it's what most Americans do in Hmong culture people find it offensive to look at other people straight into the eyes they're accustomed to looking down furthermore he finds it amusing to pat children especially on their foreheads it's normal in American culture but offensive in

entities.entity_description: Gran Torino는 문화적 갈등과 우정을 다룬 영화로, 월트와 타오 가족 간의 관계 변화를 그린다
월트는 처음에는 화가 많고 반사회적인 인물이었으나, 타오와 수와의 우정을 통해 변화하는 캐릭터이다. 인종차별적 발언을 하지만 점차 적대감이 사라진다
타오는 월트를 위해 일하며 빚을 갚고 가족의 명예를 회복하는 몽족 청년이다. 월트와 우정을 발전시킨다
수는 타오의 누나로, 월트와 우정을 쌓는 인물이다

relationships.relationship_description: 월트는 타오와 우정을 발전시키며, 타오가 월트를 위해 일하면서 관계가 형성된다
월트는 타오의 누나 수와 우정을 쌓는다
